info.description:
All the Pokémon data you'll ever need in one place, easily accessible through a modern free open-source RESTful API.

## What is this?

This is a full RESTful API linked to an extensive database detailing everything about the Pokémon main game series.

We've covered everything from Pokémon to Berry Flavors.

## Where do I start?

We have awesome [documentation](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2) on how to use this API. It takes minutes to get started.

This API will always be publicly available and will never require any extensive setup process to consume.

Created by [**Paul Hallett**(]https://github.com/phalt) and other [**PokéAPI contributors***](https://github.com/PokeAPI/pokeapi#contributing) around the world. Pokémon and Pokémon character names are trademarks of Nintendo.
info.title: PokéAPI

tags.description: Pokémon are the creatures that inhabit the world of the Pokémon games. They can be caught using Pokéballs and trained by battling with other Pokémon. Each Pokémon belongs to a specific species but may take on a variant which makes it differ from other Pokémon of the same species, such as base stats, available abilities and typings. See [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_(species)) for greater detail.
tags.name: pokemon

tags.description: Evolution is a process in which a Pokémon changes into a different species of Pokémon.
tags.name: evolution

tags.description: Berries can be soft or hard. Check out [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Category:Berries_by_firmness) for greater detail.
tags.name: berries

tags.description: An item is an object in the games which the player can pick up, keep in their bag, and use in some manner. They have various uses, including healing, powering up, helping catch Pokémon, or to access a new area.
tags.name: items

tags.description: Machines are the representation of items that teach moves to Pokémon. They vary from version to version, so it is not certain that one specific TM or HM corresponds to a single Machine.
tags.name: machines

tags.description: Locations that can be visited within the games. Locations make up sizable portions of regions, like cities or routes.
tags.name: location

tags.description: Pokémon Contests are a type of competition often contrasted with Pokémon battles and held in Contest Halls
tags.name: contest

tags.description: Moves are the skills of Pokémon in battle. In battle, a Pokémon uses one move each turn. Some moves (including those learned by Hidden Machine) can be used outside of battle as well, usually for the purpose of removing obstacles or exploring new areas.
tags.name: moves

tags.description: The Pokémon games are all video games in the Pokémon franchise.
tags.name: games

get.description: Abilities provide passive effects for Pokémon in battle or in the overworld. Pokémon have multiple possible abilities but can have only one ability at a time. Check out [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Ability) for greater detail.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description:
> Only available locally and not at [pokeapi.co](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2)
Case-insensitive query applied on the `name` property.
parameters.name: q

get.description: Abilities provide passive effects for Pokémon in battle or in the overworld. Pokémon have multiple possible abilities but can have only one ability at a time. Check out [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Ability) for greater detail.

parameters.description: This parameter can be a string or an integer.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Berries are small fruits that can provide HP and status condition restoration, stat enhancement, and even damage negation when eaten by Pokémon. Check out [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Berry) for greater detail.

get.description: Characteristics indicate which stat contains a Pokémon's highest IV. A Pokémon's Characteristic is determined by the remainder of its highest IV divided by 5 (gene_modulo). Check out [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Characteristic) for greater detail.

get.description: Pokémon are the creatures that inhabit the world of the Pokémon games. They can be caught using Pokéballs and trained by battling with other Pokémon. Each Pokémon belongs to a specific species but may take on a variant which makes it differ from other Pokémon of the same species, such as base stats, available abilities and typings. See [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_(species)) for greater detail.

parameters.description: This parameter can be a string or an integer.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Colors used for sorting Pokémon in a Pokédex. The color listed in the Pokédex is usually the color most apparent or covering each Pokémon's body. No orange category exists; Pokémon that are primarily orange are listed as red or brown.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description:
> Only available locally and not at [pokeapi.co](https://pokeapi.co/docs/v2)
Case-insensitive query applied on the `name` property.
parameters.name: q

get.description: Colors used for sorting Pokémon in a Pokédex. The color listed in the Pokédex is usually the color most apparent or covering each Pokémon's body. No orange category exists; Pokémon that are primarily orange are listed as red or brown.

get.description: Some Pokémon may appear in one of multiple, visually different forms. These differences are purely cosmetic. For variations within a Pokémon species, which do differ in more than just visuals, the 'Pokémon' entity is used to represent such a variety.

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.description: A Pokémon Species forms the basis for at least one Pokémon. Attributes of a Pokémon species are shared across all varieties of Pokémon within the species. A good example is Wormadam; Wormadam is the species which can be found in three different varieties, Wormadam-Trash, Wormadam-Sandy and Wormadam-Plant.

get.description: Pokeathlon Stats are different attributes of a Pokémon's performance in Pokéathlons. In Pokéathlons, competitions happen on different courses; one for each of the different Pokéathlon stats. See [Bulbapedia](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pok%C3%A9athlon) for greater detail.

get.description: Types are properties for Pokémon and their moves. Each type has three properties: which types of Pokémon it is super effective against, which types of Pokémon it is not very effective against, and which types of Pokémon it is completely ineffective against.
